definition: one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
tiny/miniature/slightly/profound/abtruse/to decline/one millionth part of/micro-/Taiwan pr. [wei2]
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]
to know/to be aware
to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding
the full picture (i.e. the whole situation)/panorama
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
insight/to see clearly
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to look at sth through a bamboo tube/to have a restricted view
to clearly understand
to nip in the bud (idiom)
to proceed from the outside to the inside/to see the essence merely by looking at the superficial appearance
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
miniature/scaled-down/forming a microcosm
to see clearly
penetrated/trenchant/incisive
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
to observe the past to foresee the future (idiom, taken loosely from Book of Songs); studying ancient wisdom gives insight into what is to come
to find out about/to discover
